beds.name: Nightshades & Herbs
beds.description:
Nightshades (tomatoes, peppers, eggplant) share similar growing needs: **full sun**, **consistent water**, and **warm soil**. Basil and parsley are classic tomato companions that improve flavor and deter pests.

### Layout
- **North end**: Tomatoes (they grow 6ft+ tall and will shade other plants)
- **South end**: Peppers and eggplant
- **Interplanted**: Basil between tomatoes, parsley along edges

### Cautions
- Heavy feeders - amend soil generously
- Watch for: tomato hornworms, aphids, early blight
- **3-year rotation** - don't plant where nightshades grew recently
- Stake or cage tomatoes *early* before roots establish

beds.name: Cucurbits
beds.description:
All cucurbits are **vining/sprawling plants** that need space and share pest profiles. Dill attracts beneficial insects and improves cucumber flavor. Radishes work as an early trap crop for flea beetles.

### Layout
- **One end**: Summer squash & cucumbers (harvest frequently)
- **Other end**: Winter squash & watermelon (long season, heavy sprawl)
- **Middle**: Tomatillos & ground cherries (technically nightshades but sprawl like cucurbits)
- **Early season**: Plant radishes before vines take over

### Cautions
- ⚠️ Vines **WILL** escape into paths - plan for it
- Watch for: squash vine borers, cucumber beetles, powdery mildew
- Hand-pollinate if bee activity is low
- **Drip irrigation only** - overhead water causes mildew

beds.name: Greens & Legumes
beds.description:
**Legumes fix nitrogen** in soil, which directly benefits leafy greens. Greens are cool-season crops and legumes tolerate light shade - this pairing maximizes soil fertility naturally.

### Layout
- **North end**: Peas (need 4-5ft trellis)
- **Middle rows**: Bush beans and edamame
- **Throughout**: All greens - succession plant lettuce every 2-3 weeks
- Kale and collards can stay all season

### Cautions
- Greens **bolt in heat** - provide afternoon shade or use heat-tolerant varieties
- Watch for: aphids, cabbage worms on brassica greens
- Peas need trellis or support
- ⚠️ **Keep legumes away from allium bed** - they're antagonists

beds.name: Roots & Alliums
beds.description:
Alliums (onion family) **naturally deter carrot fly** and other root pests with their strong scent. Root crops share similar needs: deep, loose, rock-free soil. Cilantro bolts to coriander seed which benefits this bed.

### Layout
- **Garlic**: Plant in fall, overwinters, harvest early summer
- **Onions**: From sets in early spring
- **Center**: Carrots and parsnips (need deepest soil)
- **Edges**: Beets and turnips
- **Succession plant**: Cilantro every few weeks (bolts quickly)

### Cautions
- Soil **must** be loose and rock-free for straight roots
- Thin carrots ruthlessly - they need space
- Garlic needs cold period - plant before first frost
- ⚠️ **Keep AWAY from legumes** - alliums inhibit their growth
- Watch for: onion maggots

beds.name: Brassicas & Potatoes
beds.description:
Potatoes and brassicas are **compatible companions** - potatoes don't compete with brassicas and both prefer cool weather. Chamomile improves brassica growth and flavor.

### Layout
- **Half the bed**: Potatoes (they spread underground)
  - Plant in trenches, hill soil as they grow
- **Other half**: Brassicas with 18-24" spacing
- **Interplanted**: Chamomile between brassicas
- Stevia tucked in corners

### Cautions
- Potatoes need **hilling 2-3 times** as they grow
- Watch for: Colorado potato beetles, cabbage worms, aphids
- Both are heavy feeders - amend well
- ⚠️ **Don't plant potatoes where tomatoes/peppers grew** (same disease family)
- Harvest potatoes after vines die back completely

beds.name: Perennials
beds.description:
All **perennials that return yearly** - grouped together so annual bed prep doesn't disturb them. Mediterranean herbs share similar preferences: **full sun, good drainage, low water**.

### Layout
- **One end**: Asparagus (spreads via roots, needs dedicated space)
- **Corner**: Rhubarb (large plant, toxic leaves - away from paths)
- **Contained area**: Horseradish (use buried barrier!)
- **Acidic pocket**: Blueberries (need separate soil amendment)
- **Fence trellis**: Grapes
- **Clustered**: All Mediterranean herbs together

### Cautions
- ⚠️ **DO NOT disturb** this bed with annual tilling
- Asparagus: 2-3 years to establish, then produces 15+ years
- ⚠️ **Horseradish WILL take over** - use bottomless bucket or root barrier
- Blueberries need **pH 4.5-5.5** - test soil and amend with sulfur
- Prune grapes in late winter when dormant
